description: Left and right arrows used for navigation. They have active and inactive states.
Used to adapt content and design to devices.
Applies a tint on an image. Used to make portfolio items look 'blue-ish', uniform on the Works page. Based on this idea.

The colors together with the color pairs. Colors don't exist alone yet in pairs, like black on white. All color pairs have a contrast ratio set for perfect readability using Lea Verou's contrast checking tool.
A text block used across all pages to display text content like portfolio description, about, or more.
Displaying images in a responsive and retina friendly way using the Picturefill library.
Two figures overlapping. On hover the top figure is fading out showing the other figure.
Flip effect used on links. Based on this Codrops article.
Typefaces and fonts used across the site. They are never used directly but set up properly with the text-style mixin.
Display flexbox items in a responsive grid. On small screens items display below each other, on larger screens in rows and columns.
A simple header containing just the logo.
Setting a container to a specific size defined by standard metrics like 16:9 (HD) or 4:3 and so on. The original idea comes from A List Apart article.
Simple link styling. By default no underline just differentiation by style. Links inside a long text are decorated with an underline, inactive menu items are marked with a line-through.
A slightly wider dash used instead of the regular dash (—). This is one of the style marks of this site's design.
The main navigation menu. The current menu item is marked with a line-through. On mobile menu items are displayed vertical otherwise horizontal.
Paragraphs. Consecutive paragraphs are separated by an empty line for better readability.
Typographic grid and scale. Different font sizes based on the Modular Scale 4:3 Perfect Fourth settings.

The HTML5 structure should outline in the HTML5 Outliner. For that all content is wrapped into semantic HTML5 elements like <section>, <article>, <nav> etc. The title of these elements are necessary to display well in the Outliner but they are hidden on the UI.
A content slider based on an idea from Google Web Fundamentals. Navigation is supported by bullets, click on image and swipe on touch-screens.
Spinning an element. Used on the 404/Not found page.
Stretching columns or rows to fill the entire viewport.

Typographic settings for different text types. Each text type has set a font, a scale, a color and parameters like letter-spacing, max-width or else. Everything text uses this text-style mixin. We don't set color or font directly for a text.
A project thumb displayed on the Work page.
A page or section title with an eventual subtitle separated with a long-dash. It can be rotated left with 90 degrees.
Smooth animation transition using a cubic-bezier function following the recommendations from Google Web Fundamentals. Used for all animations like the slider or hovering an element.
Unordered lists. No bullets or other decorators.
Uppercase text. Letters inside an uppercase text have larger letter spacing for better readability.
